attributes.action: Reduce the residential speed limit to 20mph in England
attributes.background: The Welsh parliament, Senedd Cymru, have recently backed plans to reduce the speed limit in residential areas to 20mph in Wales and we ask that residential speed limits across England are reduced to 20mph too to save lives and improve the quality of life for people in residential areas.
attributes.additional_details:
89% of pedestrian and 83% of cyclist casualties happen on urban roads. Slower speeds mean fewer collisions and a lower risk of fatal injury. Research has shown that a 1mph reduction in average speed can reduce collision frequency by 6%.
 
If a pedestrian is hit by a vehicle at 20mph, they are far more likely to survive than if they had been hit by a vehicle travelling at 30mph.
 
Lower speeds mean fewer particulates and greenhouse gases emitted, therefore fewer negative air quality impacts.

attributes.action: Require imported goods display the value of embedded GHG emissions
attributes.background: Consumer goods imported into the UK should be required to display the embedded GHG emissions, including; sourcing of materials; transportation of materials to transformation point; transformation of materials into finished product and transportation of the finished, packaged goods to the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
GHG represents the seven greenhouse gases, the main one being carbon dioxide.
 
This petition calls for the UK government to make it easier for the consumer to make more informed lifestyle choices – so they can weigh price, quality and performance on the one hand against embedded GHG emissions on the other simply by ensuring all imported consumer goods display the level of embedded GHG at the point of sale, in retail literature and on any packaging.

attributes.action: Make public transport free like it is in Luxembourg
attributes.background: The Luxembourg government has made all public transport free to reduce air pollution, congestion and greenhouse gases. It also improves the health of the general public. It's paid for out of taxes. We should too or at least make it heavily subsidized like the buses used to be in Sheffield.
attributes.additional_details: Up until the early 1980s the buses in Sheffield were heavily subsidized to such an extent that public transport was virtually free. Very few bus fares were more than 10p. Given the failure of the COP 26 Climate change conference to deliver anything of substance we should, as a G7 country, lead by example.

attributes.action: Ban all extraction of peat for horticulture by 2022.
attributes.background: The protection of our peatlands is essential in combatting climate and ecological breakdown.  A wet, pristine peat bog soaks up CO2, whereas damaged peatlands have become a significant net source of greenhouse gases, emitting over 20 million tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalents (CO2e) each year.
attributes.additional_details:
The government have committed £640m through the Nature for Climate Fund to restore 35,000 hectares of England's peatland by 2025.

DEFRA "We will also phase out the use of peat in horticulture in England by 2030, and have been clear that we will consider further measures to end the use of peat once and for all."

It seems incongruous to be depleting the peatlands whilst also dedicating to restore them. A healthy garden has no need for the use of peat, and we implore the government to act faster.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Require shops to have their lights switched off after closing
attributes.background: Many establishments still have lights or screens switched on after closing every day. This wastes electricity and causes more fossil fuels to be burned, which contributes to global warming. If the government were to force shops to switch off electronics overnight, this could be prevented.
attributes.additional_details: The continued use of electricity causes more fossil fuels to be burned—these produce greenhouse gases, which contribute to global warming. This causes climate change, which, if not acted on before 2030 (according to the UN Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change in 2018), will become irreversible, bringing about the end of life on Earth. This rule (above) would lead to a smaller amount of fossil fuels being burned, lessening the country’s carbon footprint and helping to prevent climate change.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Increase support for nuclear power to reduce reliance on fossil fuels
attributes.background: We need to open more, and keep open longer nuclear power plants to reduce our reliance on burning fossil fuels which contributes to global warming, while creating robust storage and systems for the processing of toxic waste. This would be a huge step in reducing our output of greenhouse gases.
attributes.additional_details: Nuclear power has caused relatively few deaths in comparison with the most conservative estimates of the respiratory illness and other impacts of climate change on humans. If we replace fossil fuels, this should help slow global warming and mitigate its impacts. Nuclear power is statistically much safer than many people believe and it should be exploited fully to fulfil our responsibility to take care of the Earth for future generations.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Hold COBR meetings to address the climate emergency
attributes.background: The House of Commons declared a climate emergency. COBR meetings must be held to deal with the national crisis and catastrophic disruption it will bring for people, nature, society, and environment. Action is needed now to deal with the crisis to stop fossil fuels and protect/restore nature.
attributes.additional_details: Greenhouse gases are pouring into the atmosphere at catastrophic rates and action is needed now. Current ambition is not enough. We depend on nature, but are destroying it at an alarming rate and it is in crisis. Pollution is engulfing the planet, but polluters are not paying for destruction. Current Committees are not acting at sufficient pace, or influencing action as an emergency! New plans with innovators, entrepreneurs, financiers, environmentalists, are needed to transform to a circular economy.

attributes.action: Fund free public transport for all
attributes.background: Luxembourg has made almost all public transport free to reduce air pollution, congestion and greenhouse gases. It could also help improve the health of the general public. It's paid for out of taxes. We want the UK Government to take the same action, particularly now petrol is so expensive.

attributes.action: Treat electric motorcycles as electric vehicles for BIK (Benefit In Kind)
attributes.background: Treat electric motorcycles as electric vehicles when calculating benefit in kind.
attributes.additional_details:
As well as emitting zero greenhouse and noxious gases, electric motorcycles also reduce congestion in UK cities more than electric cars. Despite this the UK government is not encouraging their use as company vehicles by treating them as electric vehicles for benefit in kind taxes. The current benefit in kind for an electric car is 0%, rising to 1% next year and then 2% for the subsequent two years. Electric motorcycles attract full benefit in kind at 20%. Why?

By signing this petition you are asking the government to treat electric motorcycles as electric vehicles that saving an enormous amount of money for electric motorcycle users and and encouraging cleaner and more congestion friendly vehicles in our city centres and uk-wide.

attributes.action: control and regulate the release of emissions from waist treatment plants
attributes.background: We want a stop to the release of odours and emissions from waist treatment sites and also regulations to be brought in to control if any the amount of possible harmful emissions and odours that can be released
attributes.additional_details:
Waist treatment sites up and down the uk are releasing possible harmful gases and odours in a in controlled and none regulated amounts 
Most of these gasses are contributing to the greenhouse effect and are drastically reducing the possibility of local councils and the uk from reaching or emissions targets

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about emissions from waste treatment facilities. However, such facilities are already regulated by the Environment Agency, who monitor the emissions such facilities are required to report to them. You can find out more about this here: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/850130/Env-reporting-guidance_inc_SECR_31March.pdf.

It's therefore not clear what more you'd like the Government to do.

You could have a petition calling for the Government to change these reporting guidelines in some specified way, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Ban unsustainable palm oil products being sold in the UK.
attributes.background: If a product contains unsustainable palm oil it shouldn’t be allowed to be imported into the UK and would be prevented from being sold in  supermarkets. We should start educating people on the harm of palm oil and the damage it is reeking across the planet.
attributes.additional_details: Palm oil had been a continual driver of deforestation, killing and heavily damaging some of the worlds most biodiverse forests. Along with this the industry is damaging the habitat of animals like the Sumatran rhino, pygmy elephant, and orangutan, all of whom are already endangered species. Climate change is being exacerbated by carbon-rich peat soils and the loss of forests, which releases millions of tonnes of greenhouse gases into the atmosphere.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Remove powers from Ofgem & replace with a regulatory body that’s fit for purpose
attributes.background: Remove a body that’s not fit for purpose and will cripple our country inadvertently pushing us into a 3rd world state.  The energy caps are perverse and the reverse of what a price cap is considering the profit levels of the energy provider owners like Centrica/Shell
attributes.additional_details:
Solar and green power options should be a choice and not forced on us all. It is a pointless act whilst you have industries chugging out greenhouse gases in economies like China and India. 
Until a global change is agreed on the current net zero policy is a virtue signalling death-knell to many of us regardless of our income levels.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want Ofgem to be replaced, but it's not clear what you want to be different about a new energy regulator.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Illegally ban the sale of Single use plastic bags
attributes.background: The average household uses 300 plastic bags per year. Not only do they get into our ocean and kill animals, when decaying the toxins from the bags enter out soil and land.  Reports also say they contribute to greenhouse gases from its production to its decaying.
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to ban the sale of single use plastic bags and only allow the sell of reusable bags. In a time where climate change is a urgent matter this is a must in order to save species and our planet

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Ban single use plastics and the unnecessary use of plastic packaging
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552450

Introduce a levy on single-use disposable plastic
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554035

attributes.action: Spend a day without using fossil fuels to prevent climate change
attributes.background: To stop fossil fuel usage in the UK for 1 day every 2 weeks. Fossil fuels are one of the major things contributing to climate change, using these produce greenhouse gases, methane, carbon dioxide and water vapour, increasing their amounts in the atmosphere, making it harder for heat energy to leave.
attributes.additional_details: To help stop climate change and reduce the amount of fossil fuels we release into the atmosphere. To save our planet, including all the animals and nature which are struggling to survive because of humanity. We can do this by walking, or bike-riding to places instead of driving, using less energy at home, eating more plant based products, throwing away less food, stopping factory productions that produce greenhouse gases, forcing them to go green and recycling, reusing and repairing more often.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the use of fossil fuels, but it's not clear exactly what action you want the Government to take. It's not clear if you want the Government to ban the use of all fossil fuels, and fossil fuel-derived products, for one day a fortnight, or do something different.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Ban the use of excess unnecessary food packaging.
attributes.background: Ban the use of excessive packaging on all prepackaged food items (eg crisp , breakfast bars). As it causes an unnecessary amount of waste , which majority of the time is not recyclable . This waste goes to landfill and then in turn will contributor to global warming.
attributes.additional_details: Prepackaged foods are causing an unnecessary amount of waste because a large majority of their manufacturers are oversizing there the wrappers and container that protect them so that there products appeared bigger than there actual size. This can been seen crisp packaging (eg, walkers) and breakfast (eg, Cadbury’s brunch bars). Landfill contributes to climate change as greenhouse gases are released, less landfill equals ,less Greenhouse gases being released Equals, less global warming .

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about unnecessary food packaging, but it's not clear what you want the Government to ban.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Make it compulsory for food products to have environmental impact traffic lights: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300770

Ban all single use plastic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300152

Ban selling drinks bottles that aren’t made out of a sustainable material: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/311520

Create charge for use of non-biodegradable material: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300421

We could accept a new petition calling for additional restrictions on food packaging, but it would need to be clear what additional restrictions you wanted the Government to impose.

attributes.action: Crack down on the meat and dairy industry and eventually ban their production
attributes.background: Laws and regulations need to be immediately introduced to crack down on the meat and dairy industry. A safety net and re-hiring scheme also needs to be set up for farmers who will be out of work. Education on the effects of a meat and dairy diet must also become compulsory for pupils at school.
attributes.additional_details: The meat and dairy industry is one of the driving forces of global warming and the increase in greenhouse gases. It is also the main cause of the UK’s number 1 killer; heart disease. Heart attacks are most often caused by cholesterol that is only found in animal products. By eventually banning meat and dairy, it will save our struggling NHS millions of pounds annually. Our Government is claiming to care for the environment, animals and our health, then why not tackle the worst thing for these?

attributes.action: Stop surplus supermarket food going to waste
attributes.background: Impose legislation that makes it illegal for larger supermarkets to throw away surplus food, with hefty fines issued for non-compliance. This will force supermarkets to install better food waste monitoring systems and redistribute any surplus food to charities and food banks.
attributes.additional_details:
At present, supermarkets are left by the Government to regulate their own food waste, with donations and redistributions entirely voluntary. As a result, well over 100,000 tonnes of edible food is thrown away by supermarkets every year. 
Food waste worldwide accounts for 3.3 giga-tonnes of greenhouse gases per year and there are currently record numbers of UK citizens having to rely on food banks in order to access a basic human right. 
This legislation will save people and our planet.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Ensure supermarkets and restaurants can give left over food to those in need
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574176

attributes.action: To stop Global Warming and care about the environmet
attributes.background: I want parliament to stop global warming by reducing the cost of electric cars and to make the price higher for cars that run on petrol and fuels diesel etc.
attributes.additional_details:
I want parliament to stop global warming. For the past 10 years the environment has gotten worse and worse and the United Kingdom
has been hotter and hotter in spring and summer and 2014 was the hottest year during the period of (1984-2020).
So I want to make a change by making parliament make prices cheaper for electric cars so pollution doesn't affect the environment in a bad way and for greenhouse gases not going to the Earth's Ozone layer and breaking it apart.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The UK Government isn't responsible for setting the price of cars, which is a decision for manufacturers and retailers.

You might like to sign this petition calling for an increase in the grant available from the Government to support the purchase of an EV

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/587687

You could start a petition calling for increased taxes on polluting vehicles, or on the cost of petrol, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Prioritise pedestrian and bicycle infrastructure over cars within our cities
attributes.background:
Clear separation of ‘roads’ primarily for inter-city car journeys, and ‘streets’ primarily for pedestrians, bicycles, necessary service vehicles (e.g. emergency, deliveries) and disabled access vehicles

Widen pavements

Create new cycle lanes

Reduce traffic and car speeds in neighbourhoods
attributes.additional_details:
1. Economic Development - people who walk or cycle make more trips to the high street and spend more money 
2. Reduction of Congestion – congestion costs average UK road user 115 hours and £894 a year  
3. Air Quality – automobile pollutants harm our health and contain greenhouses gases that cause climate change  
Demand – 77% support measures to encourage more walking and cycling 
Realistic – separated cycle lanes work. In London introduction increased usage by 53% 
  
Stats: www.cyclinguk.org

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament is responsible for.

Decisions about prioritising pedestrian and bicycle infrastructure is a matter for local authorities, not the Government or Parliament.

You could start a petition asking the Government to provide funding for local authorities to prioritise pedestrian and bike infrastructure over cars, if that's something you'd like to happen. You could also ask the Government to require local authorities to meet certain standards for pedestrian and cycling infrastructure.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for new build houses and flats to incorporate solar panels
attributes.background: To improve our green credentials the Government should ensure all new builds incorporate solar initiatives
attributes.additional_details: It's an easy way to reduce greenhouse gases

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/573013
